document_data.title: Empires of the Shining Sea
document_data.author:
[[Steven E. Schend]]
[[Dale Donovan]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Empires of the Shining Sea''''' is a 2{{nd}}-edition ''Advanced Dungeons & Dragons'' boxed set for the ''[[Forgotten Realms]]''.

{{Quote|''[[Calimshan]] and the [[Lake of Steam]] Revealed!

''The dusty trails from the North have brought you to the warm and welcoming coasts of the [[Shining Sea]] and the Lake of Steam. Here is history spanning millennia, not just centuries; passion, profit and danger; dreams of power and conquest; and wonders mysteries centuries older than any hedge realm north of Dalagar's Road and the [[Snowflake Mountains]].''

''Empires of the Shining Sea goes farther and deeper into the southern reaches of the FORGOTTEN REALMS campaign setting, providing a breadth of scope and a level of detail never before published. This boxed set includes a 192-page book filled with information on these topics:''

''History The Empires of the Shining Sea hold tales and legends passed down by word of mouth across the years. The myriad mysteries and dramas of more than 300 rulers across four empires - including the infamous [[Shoon Imperium]] - reveal themselves in the history and timeline spanning more than 8,000 years.''

''Calimshan The long-fallen empire of Calimshan rises yet again, as a new ruler and new power groups take control of the former land of the genies. Updated and expanded by more than 100 pages since its first appearance in FR3, Empires of the Sands, Calimshan shows itself to be a land bent on returning to its former greatness - at any and all costs!''

''The [[Land of the Lions]] This rugged land sandwiched between the Deepwash and the Lake of Steam seems empty, but many surprises lurk among its plains and woods - nomands and raiders astride giant lynxes, elder orbs, ruined cities, lost cultures, and more!''

''The Lake of Steam This steaming bay of the Shining Sea unveils its secrets, proving that it holds more than easy trade routes to the Inner Sea. Scarlet pearls the size of a human fist or the smoking majesty of the volcanic Arnrock tempt those who dare test its deceptively calm waters.''

''Also inside are two full-color poster maps showing Calimshan and the Lake of Steam region at 30-mile-per-inch scale.''

''Everything you need to adventure the conspiracy-laden Empires of the Shining Sea is here!''}}
document_data.Description:
''Empires of the Shining Sea'' provides an in-depth look at the geography, history, and cultures of the regions surrounding the Shining Sea. This includes the Empires of Calimshan, Tethyr, and the Lake of Steam area. It has extensive details on the major cities and towns within these empires, including their history, architecture, politics, and daily life.

It explores the complex political dynamics and historical events that have shaped the region. This included conflicts, alliances, and the rise and fall of various rulers and factions. It also provided insights into the customs, festivals, religions, and day-to-day life of the people living in the region. It also has descriptions of new monsters, NPCs, and deities that are specific to the Empires of the Shining Sea.

''Empires of the Shining Sea'' introduces new character classes, kits, spells, or equipment that are unique to the region, offering players additional options for character creation and development. It provides a variety of adventure hooks and ideas for campaigns set in this region, giving Dungeon Masters tools to create engaging stories rooted in the local context.
document_data.Contents:
* Part One: History of Empires
** Prologue
** The Ancient Past
** Age of Shoon
** The Post-lmperium Ages
** The Modern Age
* Part Two: Calimshan
** Calimshan Overview
** Society and Customs
** Politics and Power
** Wild Calimshan
** Civilized Calimshan
* Part Three: The Arnaden Region
** Land of the Lions and the Arnaden City-State
** Nomadic Traditions
** Wilderness of the Shadi'ar
** Cities of the Arnaden
* Part Four: Appendices
** Appendix I: Power Groups
** Appendix II: Slavery
** Appendix III: Magic
